item.title: 8 Best Cover Shooter Games Ever
item.description:
In the 80s and 90s, shooters of every variety were mostly based on running and gunning down opponents. It didn’t matter if it was a side-scroller like Contra or a first-person game like Doom , players were encouraged to blast enemies like they had infinite lives or health. Then there was a shift, as some games started to add cover systems, like Time Crisis in arcades.

Home consoles also got a big mechanical revolution in 2003 via Kill Switch, a relatively mundane third-person shooter on platforms like the PS2 and Xbox with one standout feature: its cover system . It was an important step, but no one really remembers that game as well as they do these other experiences. Taking cover plays a big part in the following games, and they each represent the best of the cover shooter genre.

Gears Of War

Run Roadie, Run

Gears of War
8.8 /10
Released
November 7, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Epic Games
Powered by

The first Gears of War is still considered the best game in the series, which is the game that most point to as the experience that brought cover shooters to prominence. Each mission gave players a small squad to buddy up with, or they could join up with another player in co-op.

If players didn’t take cover from the Locust enemies, they would die quickly. As beefy as Marcus Fenix is, he's still a human after all. The shooting felt great, running between cover was thrilling, and the chainsaw gun was jaw-dropping. The whole experience can now be played on PlayStation consoles via Gears of War: Reloaded , which is the best modern way to play.

Mass Effect 2

A Squad-Based RPG

Mass Effect 2
8 /10
11
9.1 /10
Released
January 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
BioWare
Powered by

Mass Effect 2 is the middle child of the trilogy, but it is deemed the best entry in the Mass Effect saga among fans. All three games in the trilogy are great and are essential to play in order, but there’s no denying the power of the series' dark middle chapter.

Most of the gameplay was carried over from the first game, but with a few tweaks. Ammo was scarce, adding to the tension of gunfights as players had to issue companion orders more thoughtfully and use their class-based powers well. It’s one of the few RPGS out there with branching storylines that is also a competent cover shooter.

Uncharted 2: Among Thieves

Is That My Blood?

Uncharted 2: Among Thieves
9 /10
10
9.7 /10
Released
October 13, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Naughty Dog
Powered by

The Uncharted series is a fun mix between intense, cover-based shooting segments, action-adventure platforming, and puzzle-solving scenarios. Uncharted 2: Among Thieves is the best entry in the series, which upped the ante of the original in several ways.

The cover-based shooting was more responsive, there were more varied environments and set pieces, including cityscapes, and the character dynamics were better written. Nathan Drake may not be a beefy traditional shooter hero like Marcus Fenix, but he gets the job done whether he has a rifle, pistol, or bandolier of grenades.

Binary Domain

Beware The Robot Uprising

Binary Domain
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
February 28, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio
Powered by

Binary Domain takes place in the future where once-friendly robots have turned against mankind. Players are sent in to control the dissent, one robot kill at a time. In between missions, players can choose two teammates to accompany them on their next outing, each with a different skill set, from a general weapons expert to a trained sniper.

Behind cover, players can issue orders, and if they train their teammates well, their affection will rise. It’s one of the better squad-based shooters out there, one that gives players a reason to be a better leader, as clean orders can help players unlock upgrades quicker.

Tom Clancy's The Division

Money Problems

Tom Clancy’s The Division
8.5 /10
Released
March 8, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Massive Entertainment
Powered by

Tom Clancy's The Division is the first game in the series that established The Division, a secret military group that is activated when things go sideways in the country. The inciting incident happens in New York City, where a money-plagued disease ravaged the population on Black Friday. Quarantined from the rest of the U.S., players must fight back against factions that sprang up in the chaos.

There are classes and plenty of weapons to equip, as it is a looter shooter, but like most Tom Clancy games, the gameplay is grounded. There are no ice blasts or fireballs to be thrown here, just thoughtful tactical cover action in a ravaged war zone, which could be played solo or with three other friends.

Outriders

Adding Magic To Cover

Outriders
8 /10
Released
April 1, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
People Can Fly
Powered by

Outriders is another RPG, but this one utilizes three-player online co-op for its squad-based tactics. Players could choose between four classes, each with a special skill set, like the Pyromancer using fire powers to burn enemies to ash.

No matter the class, players still had to utilize cover in firefights because enemies often outnumbered them, even in co-op. Outriders was also loot-based, so players had a wide array of weapons and gear to comb through on their quest to establish freedom on this war-torn planet.

Killzone: Liberation

A Tactically Brilliant Spinoff

Killzone: Liberation
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
October 31, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Guerrilla Games
Powered by

Killzone: Liberation was a PSP spinoff of the legendaryb PlayStation franchise, and it was a top-down shooter. It utilized a cover system, so it was more like a tactical shooter than the mainline games, which were all about blasting Helghast soldiers in first-person.

Liberation is one of the few Killzone games that is widely available on PS5 consoles, thanks to a quick emulated port. The bite-sized missions, reward system, and challenging gameplay make this spinoff one of the better games in the series and a great, albeit smaller, cover shooter experience.

Vanquish

Why Didn’t Cover Systems Evolve After This?

Vanquish
6.0 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Platinum Games
Powered by

Vanquish is one of PlatinumGames’ most underrated titles, and one that could have revolutionized the cover shooter market if anyone paid attention. Players fought robots and enemy soldiers of all kinds in space, but with their power suits, they had an advantage.

With enough juice in the tank, players could dodge bullets or slide past enemies at ridiculous speeds to get to cover, all of which would happen in slow motion. This made combat more dynamic, as it was easier and more exhilarating to get from cover to cover by sliding along the ground than by simply running, which was still a necessary and incredibly fun element of the game.

item.title: Take-Two Stock Takes Big Hit After GTA 6 Announcement
item.description:
Following the delay of Grand Theft Auto 6 to November 2026, Take-Two Interactive's stock on the NASDAQ stock exchange took a nosedive during after-hours trading, resulting in a loss of nearly 10% for the company. While Take-Two's stock began climbing back up slightly, the hit happened within minutes of the Grand Theft Auto 6 delay announcement on social media by Rockstar Games.

It's no secret that GTA 6 has had a tumultuous development cycle, as the game had already been delayed a few times before the November 6 announcement. GTA 6 will take place in Vice City, a Miami-based metropolis that first appeared in 2002's Grand Theft Auto: Vice City , as players experience the criminal escapades of protagonists Jason Duval and Lucia Caminos. During Take-Two Interactive's Q2 2026 financial results meeting, Rockstar Games confirmed that GTA 6 would be delayed to November 19, 2026. The developer clarified that this would allow for more development time and some extra polish on the final product.

Take-Two Interactive Stocks Down Nearly 10% Following GTA 6 Delay

With Rockstar Games no longer committing to its May 26 launch window for GTA 6 , its parent company is now facing some financial headwinds on Wall Street. According to the NASDAQ market reports, Take-Two Interactive, Inc. (TTWO) common stock dropped by around 10%, from $252.50 a share to as low as $219.87, immediately after GTA 6 's delay was confirmed. The stock price drop happened at 4:06 PM Eastern, exactly one minute after Rockstar Games posted about the delay on social media. The stock drop also happened during after-hours trading, as the stock exchange closed for the day at 4:00 PM Eastern.

Since the drop, Take-Two's stock has slightly gone back up to $234.88 as of this writing, but still remains down by 17.52 points, or 6.94%, from the previous close. For comparison, the stock of Take-Two Interactive hit a high of $258.10 a share on September 26, which then increased to $262.29 on October 20. With GTA 6 now pushed back to the latter months of 2026, Take-Two's stock has tumbled by a margin of $42.42 between its highest and lowest points in a one-month span.

Despite the stock hit and the six-month release delay, Grand Theft Auto 6 remains one of 2026's most anticipated games. Although the latest move back is a major difference from the previously established launch window, only time will tell how many adjustments Rockstar Games will make to GTA 6 before its anticipated arrival late next year.

Grand Theft Auto 6

Follow
Followed
Action
Adventure
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
May 26, 2026
ESRB
Rating Pending - Likely Mature 17+
Developer(s)

DIGITAL

Grand Theft Auto VI heads to the state of Leonida, home to the neon-soaked streets of Vice City and beyond in the biggest, most immersive evolution of the Grand Theft Auto series yet.

Jason and Lucia have always known the deck is stacked against them. But when an easy score goes wrong, they find themselves on the darkest side of the sunniest place in America, in the middle of a criminal conspiracy stretching across the state of Leonida — forced to rely on each other more than ever if they want to make it out alive.

item.title: PSA: You Can Get Some of Fallout 76's Best Loot Right Now
item.description:
Fallout 76 has had a good streak of events as of late. A Halloween mini-season brought some morgue-themed rewards to chase while populating Appalachia with Spooky Scorched, and it ran alongside a free Fallout 1st trial that showed just how valuable Fallout 76 ’s Scrapbox can be. After a few days off, Fallout 76 has started up an event longtime players may be familiar with: Treasure Hunt. This event hasn’t had new items added to the pool for its last few appearances, and this latest run is no different, but it has such a wide range of unlocks that newer players and veterans who don’t already have all the items shouldn’t miss out on the chance to play this week.

Fallout 76 ’s latest Treasure Hunt will run from November 6 to November 10, and for those who haven’t taken part in it, it’s fairly simple. Players will find Treasure Hunter Mole Miners all throughout Appalachia, as they don’t only spawn in typical Mole Miner locations. So long as players are not fighting a scripted group of enemies tied to a quest, and are out in the open-world as opposed to an interior location, they’ll run into Treasure Hunters quite often. Whenever one of these Legendary Mole Miners is killed, players will want to check the Pails they drop for loot, as they will be filled with special plans and other items worth collecting. The pails come in three variants — Dusty, regular, and Ornate — with each tier increasing players' chances to get rare drops.

Players can also craft Mole Miner Pails by purchasing empty Pails from vendors and crafting their own loot-filled Pail at a Tinker’s Workbench.

Fallout 76’s Treasure Hunt Event Drops

  • Cursed Rolling Pin
  • Cursed Sickle
  • Cursed Broadsider
  • Deathclaw Hunter Outfit
  • Deathclaw Hunter Hat
  • Garrahan Foreman Outfit
  • Garrahan Foreman Hat
  • Grafton Monster Mask
  • Strongman Outfit
  • Plan: Circus Cage Trailer
  • Plan: Insurgent Hat
  • Plan: Insurgent Outfit
  • Plan: Marine Armor Helmet
  • Plan: Radstag Hunting Knife
  • Plan: Safari Crocolossus Backpack
  • Plan: Treasure Hunter Outfit
  • Plan: Treasure Hunter Outfit Hat
  • Plan: Safari Gorilla Backpack
  • Plan: Grafton Monster Lamp
  • Plan: Animatronic Clown
  • Plan: Wanamingo Plushie
  • Plan: Bed of Nails
  • Plan: Strongman's Super Sledge Paint
  • Plan: Bouquet of Star Balloons
  • Plan: Scorched Tube
  • Plan: Neon Light Diner Clock
  • Plan: Balloon Arch
  • Plan: Vault 76 Rug
  • Plan: Scorchbeast Queen Plushie
  • Plan: WV State Bird Rug
  • Plan: Small Vault Girl Statue
  • Plan: Yao Guai Tube
  • Plan: Junkyard Fountain
  • Plan: Camo Backpack
  • Plan: Snallygaster Plushie
  • Plan: Small Supply Crate (Only if not earned in Nuclear Winter)
  • Plan: Pink Sprinkles Power Armor Paints (Only if not earned in Nuclear Winter)
  • Plan: Laser Gun Blue Camo Paint (Only if not earned in Nuclear Winter)
  • Plan: Missile Launcher Atom Cats Paint (Only if not earned in Nuclear Winter)
  • Plan: Cave Cricket Tube
  • Plan: Fire Station Bell
  • Plan: TV Aquarium
  • Plan: Raw Cement Barricade

Fallout 76’s Treasure Hunt Event is a Boon For Newer Players

If you recently started Fallout 76 for the first time, or came back after hearing how much it’s improved (or because of the hype surrounding Fallout ’s TV series), this event is truly a must-play. I’m someone who came back to Fallout 76 after over half a decade away from the game, as I dropped it shortly after launch due to the state of the game at the time. This makes me the perfect target audience for the latest run of the event, as all the items that can drop are things that I still need. There are a few really cool plans in particular I’m hoping to get, though.

I recently started building CAMPs in Fallout 76 , and while it didn’t take long for me to max out the budget of my log cabin, I still have an entire shelter to design. Naturally, it’ll be decorations I want the most, so I’d be thrilled to see the cute Snallygaster, Wanamingo, and Scorchbeast Queen Plushies drop. As someone who loves fishing in Fallout 76 and wants to create a fishing CAMP at some point, the TV Aquarium is another must. The Neon Light Diner Clock and Grafton Monster lamp would also be fun to get. Outfit-wise, I’m desperate for the Pink Sprinkles Power Armor Paint, Missile Launcher Atom Cats Paint, and the animal-themed backpacks. Even if I get just a few of these items, I’ll be thrilled, and I’ll be looking forward to the next appearance of the greedy Mole Miners to snag the rest of the items.

For dedicated players who have all the loot in this event, it’s still a decent way to farm Legendary Scrip and Caps since they can drop from Mole Miner and Ornate Pails (Dusty ones do not have these drops). While the Treasure Hunts will resume on December 4 for those who want to wait for the TV show and Burning Springs hype to be at its peak, getting in one event run now and another in December gives players a far better chance at obtaining all the potential drops.

47
8.1 /10
5 /10

Fallout 76

item.title: Arc Raiders Has Made Me A Lot More Optimistic About the Future of the Genre
item.description:
As a longtime gamer, Arc Raiders has proven to be a big surprise for me. I was around four or five years old when I picked up my first controller as my older, and much cooler, cousin taught me how to play Banjo Kazooie . Gaming has grown leaps and bounds since then, and Arc Raiders is a perfect example of just how much the industry has changed. Ever since Fortnite hit the scene back in 2017, a lot of the industry has been saturated by battle royale offerings, but Arc Raiders is paving the way for a new genre to be in the middle of the spotlight: the extraction shooter.

Extraction shooters are nothing new, but they have definitely become a hotter topic of discussion, especially this year. Before Arc Raiders , some of the most notable titles in the genre were Escape from Tarkov and Hunt: Showdown 1896 . Now that Escape from Tarkov is about to release its 1.0 version, the genre is going to be in the news even more. On top of that, though, Bungie has its own extraction shooter on the way. Marathon was supposed to launch this year, but it has since been delayed to 2026. However, once it arrives, it will be yet another big-name extraction shooter that further cements the genre as the next big thing. I'll be honest, this trend has made me a bit nervous about the future of gaming, but thanks to Arc Raiders , I've become a lot more optimistic about this genre making waves.

Arc Raiders Has Showed Me Just How Wonderful the Extraction Shooter Genre Can Be

Up until recently, the industry's lean into extraction shooters in the future definitely had me cautious, because I simply haven't been able to get into the genre. Escape from Tarkov is grueling, and as much as I enjoy the setting and atmosphere of Hunt: Showdown 1896 , it just didn't click with me. However, Arc Raiders has ticked boxes I wasn't expecting, especially when it comes to detail and world building. Arc Raiders may not be a narrative-driven game (which is my usual preference), but with the lore and world that the game offers in its setting, the story can still be felt.

The dynamic maps, the incredible music, and the sweat-inducing fight for survival immediately pulled me in, and it's made me far more excited about extraction shooters being the next big thing in gaming. What's even more charming is that Arc Raiders encourages kindness. For the most part, players are fighting to survive together, even if they're solo. It's incredibly easy to just shoot another player, but a lot of the community has come together to realize that the ultimate threat is the ARC, and any humans encountered along the way are ultimately on your team.

It's such a refreshing change of pace, and while this is likely going to be an aspect that is mostly unique to Arc Raiders , it's another example of how the game has unexpectedly won me over. I had mentioned world building earlier, and that's definitely one of my top compliments that I have about the game as a whole. Of course, the gameplay loop and graphics are fantastic, but I'm already completely invested in Arc Raiders ' world, and I can't wait to learn more. Developer Embark Studios set this game up in such a way that it could have years of content and deeper lore waiting in the wings, and that's a thrilling thought.

Arc Raiders Should Become the Extraction Shooter Blueprint

While there have been a handful of extraction shooters released in recent years, Arc Raiders has managed to draw the most attention. One of the most important qualities of Arc Raiders is that it's incredibly approachable. Yes, it's a challenge, but it also respects a player's time, allowing for a more casual experience that is still rewarding.

Upcoming Extraction Shooters

  • Marathon -release date TBA
  • Exoborne - release date TBA

Both Marathon and Exoborne are the extraction shooters to keep an out for post- Arc Raiders . It may not seem like the extraction shooter floodgates have been completely opened just yet, but it definitely feels like the industry is eyeing the genre closely, especially now that Arc Raiders has amassed such positive feedback. After Bungie's past playtests ignited heavily mixed reviews from participants, Marathon has gone back to the drawing board, and Arc Raiders is hopefully being eyed as a title to emulate. The visuals for Marathon are stunning, so the gameplay and lore can hopefully help it stick the landing when it's ready for launch.

Of course, the gameplay loop and graphics are fantastic, but I'm already completely invested in Arc Raiders ' world, and I can't wait to learn more.

The Future of Arc Raiders Hopefully Lives Up to Expectations

  • More maps have already been confirmed for future updates.
  • Expanding maps will also expand the story and lore.

The world of Arc Raiders already feels incredibly vast and detailed, but it will be fascinating to see where Embark Studios take the game with future updates. It's also bound to be hard to live up to expectations, too, though. As a fresh game, Arc Raiders feels shiny and new, but after a while, the upcoming content will hopefully continue to keep the fires burning. While this is difficult, it definitely isn't impossible. Helldivers 2 has managed to keep its ongoing content and updates enticing, and even though it isn't an extraction shooter, it could still be a solid source of inspiration for Arc Raiders down the road.

Arc Raiders ' potential feels like it has no limit at the moment, and only time will tell if that's actually the case. Right now, though, Arc Raiders has completely changed my tone on what extraction shooters can be. Extraction Shooters can serve as the base for a lot of creativity to flow from, and that has given rise to a beautifully crafted world with incredibly fun gameplay. Because of this, it makes me far more excited to see how other developers take this formula and use it to create their own unique worlds and make the genre their own.

9.1 /10
10 /10

ARC Raiders

item.title: PEAK: How to Cook & Eat a Mandrake (Cryptogastronomy Badge)
item.description:
If you thought the achievements in PEAK couldn’t get any weirder, the Roots update proves otherwise. Instead of climbing daring heights or surviving brutal storms, the new Cryptogastronomy Badge requires you to cook and eat a screaming plant known as the Mandrake. This guide will walk you through how to find, cook, and safely eat a Mandrake to claim the Cryptogastronomy Badge in PEAK .

Where To Find a Mandrake in PEAK

First things first, you need to find a Mandrake. To do so, you’ll need to reach the Roots biome, which is the new map introduced in the Roots update. Until November 17, 2025 , this biome is guaranteed to appear after the Shore , making it the best time to go Mandrake hunting before it rotates with the Tropics biome later.

Once you’re in the Roots biome in PEAK , start searching through shrubs and patches of earth for Medicinal Roots. These orange, plant-like items grow in clusters and are usually used as healing resources. Occasionally, when you pull one out, you’ll find a Mandrake. It looks nearly identical to a Medicinal Root but has a creepy little face and immediately begins screaming as soon as you pull it out.

When a Mandrake screams, it inflicts the Drowsy status effect on anyone nearby. This can cause you and your teammates to pass out.

How to Cook and Eat a Mandrake in PEAK

Once you’ve got a Mandrake, it’s time to cook it. The safest and easiest way to do this is with a Portable Stove , a common item found in the Shore biome. This stove lets you cook any time, anywhere.

It’s best to carry a Portable Stove if you’re aiming to get this badge in PEAK . If you don’t have one, you’ll need to carry the Mandrake to a campfire as quickly as possible. Campfires are usually found at the top of the biome or near checkpoints. Just be careful not to drop the Mandrake or faint along the way.

When you’ve reached a safe cooking spot, place the Mandrake on the stove or campfire to cook it. After it’s done, eat the cooked Mandrake. Consuming it will instantly unlock the Cryptogastronomy Badge.

After you unlock the badge and complete your climb, you’ll receive the Sprout Hat. This small, leafy cosmetic is your reward for claiming the Cryptogastronomy Badge.

9.4 /10

PEAK
